statement.p: Points A and B are separated by a lake. To find the distance between them, a surveyor locates a point C on land such than \displaystyle\angle{C}{A}{B}={45.4}^\circ. Find the distance across the lake from A to B.
statement.em: NOTE: The triangle is NOT drawn to scale.

p.em: Enter your answer as a number; your answer should be accurate to 2 decimal places.
